simlib.energy.Angle¶

class simlib.energy.Angle(xyz0, xyz1, xyz2, ideal_value=1.0, force_constant=1.0)[source]¶

Compute the potential energy of an angle

The energy of an angle follows Hooke’s law:

\[U = \frac{1}{2} k (\theta - \theta_0)^2\]

The differential must be split by the components of vectors \(u\) and \(v\), which are used to compute the angle \(\theta\):

\[\frac{\delta U}{\delta x} = -k (\theta - \theta_0) sin^{-1}(\theta) v_x\]
\[\frac{\delta U}{\delta v_x} = -k (\theta - \theta_0) sin^{-1}(\theta) u_x\]

The derivation:

\[\frac{\delta U}{\delta \theta} = k (\theta - \theta_0)\]
\[\theta = acos(u \cdot v)\]
\[\frac{\delta \theta}{\delta (u \cdot v)} = \frac{-1}{\sqrt{1 - (u \cdot v)^2}} = \frac{-1}{\sqrt{1 - cos^2(\theta)}} = \frac{-1}{\sqrt{sin^2(\theta)}} = -sin^{-1}(\theta)\]

. . math:: u cdot v = u_x v_x + u_y v_y + u_z v_z .. math:: frac{delta (u cdot v)}{delta u_x} = v_x .. math:: frac{delta (u cdot v)}{delta v_x} = u_x
